11131.content:
It was an awkward moment when everyone found the stadium.

Mario and company chased the Koopa Troop there, while Sonic and the Freedom Fighters all chased Eggman's forces there. They all wanted to see what that power source they detected was... only to find out they had been chasing each other.

"...Well," Sonic said.

"Yeah..." Mario said. The two stared at each other awkwardly while Bowser and Dr. Eggman glared at one another.

"This is a colossal waste of time," Bowser said, turning to leave.

"I agree," Dr. Eggman grumped. "Move out. We're going home!"

"I don't know," Peach said, admiring the architecture of the stadium. "A little cleaning, some magic here and there, and it would make a great place for an Olympic stadium."

Mario blinked. "You serious?" he asked.

Sally frowned. "Wait, magic?"

Peach nodded, creating some sparkles. "Our kingdom is rife with magic. Maybe combining it with your world's technology, we can set up some great games." She turned to Bowser and Eggman, the latter still leaving, the former having stopped to listen. "You all are invited, of course, so long as you play fair."

"You have got to be kidding," Eggman said.

"...No, no, we've done this before," Bowser said.

"SERIOUSLY?!" Eggman asked, shocked.

Bowser nodded. "Yeah. Sometimes I go go-karting with these losers. Or play sports, or this giant magic board game thing..." he shrugged. "It's something to do between conquest attempts. And honestly," he added with a vicious grin, "its rather satisfying to beat them in fair combat."

Peach nodded. "Paranormal-level abilities would be suppressed, of course," she said. "To keep everything fair."

"No zipping around at the speed of sound for you if we take part," Tails said to Sonic, getting the idea.

Sonic snorted. "Don't know how happy I am about that..."

Eggman stroked his mustache, looking thoughtful. "...I suppose. I don't really have any new plans... Not to sure about this 'playing fair' nonsense. But I do like the idea of beating Sonic at something."

Mario turned to Sonic. "So how about it?" he said. "I'm-a gonna go for it, Mr..."

"Sonic the Hedgehog," Sonic said. After a moment's thought, he added, "And yeah, it does sound fun."

"I'm-a Mario," Mario said, shaking Sonic's head.

Relucantly, everyone else agreed to it as well.

And so it began. Six teams were made. Team Mushroom Kingdom. Team Freedom Fighters. Team Eggman Empire. Team Koopa Troop. Team Independent Nasties. Team Civilian Heroes. The latter two teams blended heroes and villains from both worlds. The contests would last three months, with the winning team being granted wishes from a wishing star. And to win? Why, you simply had to have the most gold medals...

11132.content:
Sonic had to admit - holding sporting events was a great idea. He didn't like the fact that his superspeed powers were suppressed to keep the contest fair, but he was still fast enough to get gold in most racing events. Plus, Eggman tended to play fair, wanting to beat Sonic in fair combat. And the events were always interesting too.

On top of that, he just liked meeting new people. Mario and his group of friends and enemies were an interesting bunch. There had been some tensions at first, but everyone eventually settled into the routine of the Olympics. Today, for example, Bowser Junior, Metal Sonic, Captain Toad, and Tundra were all competing in a swimming competition.

(He was silently glad to be left out of that one. He couldn't swim, and was the only one who had to walk on the bottom with a life vest and oxygen tank. It was humiliating.)

Sonic wasn't scheduled to compete until two days from now. Which meant he had time to sneak around and have some naughty fun. The villainesses on both sides tended to mellow out during the games, and were a lot easier to talk to and flirt with. Plus, Sonic was something of a ladies man. Every married couple he knew was in an open relationship, and he had an almost complete success rate in dating.

Now the question was who to visit for some fun?

Eggman himself comes for the device...
11242.content:
"Basically, it's a self-sustaining storage enhancer!" Tails explained, smiling as he held up the device. It was a small, black sphere, with a slight glow to it. "It uses those artificial Phantom Ruby shards we took from Dr. Eggman's lab to create a field that perfectly preserves whatever's meant to be stored inside it for... well, ever. All you have to do is put the device in a storage container. It will automatically calibrate to it."

"Seriously?" Sonic asked, smiling. "How's that work?"

"That's the beauty of it. It works by tapping into the energy of what's being stored and using it to empower the storage container and keep it running, while also keeping it from experiencing wear and tear. The container, enhanced by the device, then produces an energy field that keeps whatever's inside it in a field of stasis that will last as long as the container does. Which, thanks to the energy recycling, will be pretty much forever."

"I think I get it," Sonic said, looking thoughtful for a moment. "Basically I put that thing in a fridge, and then I could keep a leftover chilidog in there for years, and it'd still be fresh and delicious when I pulled it out?"

"That's actually a perfect example!" Tails said, smiling. "The device would use the energy of the food items in the fridge to empower it, and generate a stasis field to keep the food fresh. I'm working on a version that will work with stored inanimate objects."

Sonic quirked an eyebrow. "It only works with food, then?"

"Organics in general," Tails clarified. "The device basically recycles bioenergy in and out of something endlessly. I've actually been working on something similar for a while, but until I added the Phantom Ruby shard, it made the stored material actually degrade in quality. Now, though? Perfect cycling and perfect preservation."

"Neat!" Sonic said, grinning.

Tails smiled. "But that's not all - it also increases the internal storage capacity of the object by a millionfold, AND makes the entrance to the container capable of stretching to fit." He grinned excitedly. "Think of the benefit to food banks! To hospitals! Heck, to waste disposal! You could put tons of organic waste in easy storage containers and keep the land beautiful! It wouldn't rot, sure, but that's just another project!"

Sonic patted his genius friend on the back. "Heckuva job, pal. Why don't I treat you to a chilidog?" he said.

"Can I have pizza instead?" Tails asked, grinning sheepishly. "I'm kinda tired of chilidogs..."

"Blasphemer," Sonic teased. "Yeah, sure, we can get pizza."

"Thanks, Sonic," Tails said, setting the device down on a tray.

"...With chilidog sauce on it," Sonic added, smirking.

Tails laughed, and the two dashed off.

Communing with the Master Emerald was fulfilling, he had plenty of wild game and fruit to eat, clean water to drink, and he was content. The only thing that could break his discontent? Intruders. He hated other people. He liked his life the way it was, and anyone who interfered with that would die in the worst way he could think of.

Ever since Sonic and Eggman showed up... it soured him on any further social interaction. He wouldn't let anyone get away. An intruder!

115223.content:
A booming, buzzing peal pervaded the external gangway, the everlasting fracas of the airship's many airscrews accentuated by Rouge's boots' chiming as she ran across the metal bridge. The limber Bat knew she was close to her target now, drawing near a thick, steel door at the end of the mezzanine. She paused a little while to catch her breath, wiping sweat from her white-furred brow. Her rest was brief, however. Suddenly, a loud, sharp ping and, strangely, the sound of breaking glass denoted that a sharpshooter was nearby.

The shot had just narrowly evaded hitting her, the Bat grasping sight of a spark as metal pounded metal. "Crap!" Rouge growled, seeking protection behind a sturdy steel pipe, grateful for its presence as the sound of another ping validating that she was still being targeted, "And here I all but believed this was going to be trouble-free!" True enough, the Bat had faced little opposition on Eggman's airship thus far, his latest repeat of the Final Fortress cutting corners on the safety hallmarks. There had been the usual beats of the mad scientist's E-Series bots, but they had been easy enough for the thief to keep away from, the amalgam of her wings and spryness allowing her to slip past easily.

Perhaps that was why Doctor Ivan Robotnik's reasonings lately had been more practical than usual. The villain used his airship and automated army for raiding strikes against the smaller towns and villages. If he couldn't afford the conventional protection for his flying fortress, all the hits on banks and museums made a lot more sense. That cake was something the stealthy Bat had been more than eager to get a chunk of. After a little digging around, the thief had been able to find some of the engineers forced to work on Eggman's ship.

Soon after, he found herself in possession of its complete blueprints, including the location of the rotund tyrant's treasure room. Peeking her head out from around the pipe, the Bat grimaced and pulled back behind cover just as another shot swished by her head. She had only gotten a glance, but it was enough to know her enemy: A more particular E-Series, this bot with a much thinner body than usual, gave it an outline that was a little harder to spot from far off. Fortunately for her, she now knew its position; Unfortunately for her, it recognized hers too. This wasn't going to be like the other robots she had run into so far; there was no creeping past now.

If the motorized doorway were like the other ones she'd seen on this ship, it would open far too leisurely for her to slide through before being shot. She wasn't getting out of this without challenging her attacker head-on. Taking a deep breath, the Bat pulled up her thick white and pink-cuffed gloves. In one rapid movement, the batgirl extended her wings, ducked out from cover, and gripped the nearby railing with her hands before launching herself into the endless heavens beneath her. Shots continued to come after the Bat as she collapsed her wings, launching down towards the floor, each one missing just as she knew they would.

Even one of the good doctor's machines wouldn't have been able to hit her at this tempo, but this wasn't the tricky part again. Extending her wings again, she coasted down, and then up back around the platform the sniper was on, hoping to catch it unready as she flapped her wings to gain even more altitude. As she cleared the platform's bottom, she found herself with the high ground on her attacker. However, the bot had tracked her with skilled accuracy; its rifle placed straight at her. "No!" She cried out as a loud bang resounded throughout the surrounding metal beams and airship dividers, the thief having only enough time to raise her arm in a futile effort at self-defense.

Pain discharged through her arm as her eyes grew wide in dread. But the blow did not travel through and hit her in the chest as she had expected. Somehow, her instinctual, last-ditch block had worked! A quick series of clicks and whirrs drew Rouge's awareness back to her attacker.

Rouge roared in rage as she dived down upon the E-Series bot, another shot echoing around them and sending the Bat's large, supersensitised ears ringing as the rifle went off beside them. The thief was unscathed this time, and there was nothing the sharpshooter could do as a swift kick to its middle, her seashell white, heart-adorned boots slamming with its metal torso with a thundering and satisfying clank. The bandit's large, teal eyes met the robot's hot magenta, yet frosty and emotionless photoreceptors as it was sent soaring off of the walkway. The assassin robot's tall body and rifle were both sent gyrating; it's pipe-like arms flailing as they hurtled down towards the Earth far below. Grinning, Rouge turned back towards where the walkway was before wincing in pain.

She looked down, filled with shock and relief as she finally caught sight of her injury; repose because it wasn't the bullet hole she had feared, and excitement because there was a small dart protruding out of the bare skin of her arm. She pressed her eyes shut as she pulled it out, scowling as she inspected what seemed to be a mix between a dart and a hypodermic needle. Its contents were drained, leaving the glass vial that served as the projectile's body almost empty beyond a few tiny dark, electric indigo beads.

"Shit!" She snarled, before stowing the dart in her generous bosom, the projectile stored safely behind her heart-shaped chest plate, "I suppose that means whatever toxin Robotnik filled it with is already inside me..."

She looked over her gash now, observing the same indigo color as the liquid subtly shading the veins around it. She hopelessly compressed her lips to it and attempted to extract the poison out, hawking some of it into the air, but realizing she was far too late to stop it all. Whatever it was, it was flowing through her now. It seems like she'd soon need to find both the treasure room and an antidote.

Flying back to the catwalk, the Bat landed with a groan, banging the lever to open the unfasten and running inside as soon as the steel door disjointed open.

Now finding herself in a long sequence of hallways, the Bat ran through them, following the blueprints she had learned by heart as she thought more on the dart that had hit her. Undoubtedly whatever she had been injected with wasn't meant to kill her, else Robotnik would have just loaded his sneaky sniper bot with lead. Whatever it was she had been administered with, though, it didn't bode well. The doctor was up to something, and Rouge desperately hoped that she could get in and out of that vault and back on solid ground, preferably near some medical treatment, before she could find out.

Rouge continued to rush through the hallways, panting and huffing as she drew ever closer to her destination. The treasure room wasn't far now, but after her confrontation with the sniper, she was eager to get this over with, mainly as her abdomen grumbled hungrily. Get the treasure, get out, sort out the venom, then a big warm dinner.

"Sounds great," She huffed as she came to a different door.

As the Bat was about to estimate how to get through it, it began to open. The thief leaped to the roof, flapping her wings to give her air before she grabbed hold of a large pipe and clung to it lengthwise, hiding from sight as best as possible. A familiar series of clicking and clanking declared a stock E-100 series guard bot before it could even walk out the door. With a gun in one hand and a sack in the other, the guard bot swiveled its stout head over its chest, looking back and forth along the crisscrossing hallways, scanning them for intruders before striding down the one Rouge had entered through. After a few seconds, it disappeared around a corner, and the batgirl dropped down to the floor, slipping between the massive vault doors just as they sealed shut behind her.

"Another easy break-in! Now for the master thief to - wait, what the hell is this?!"

Hesitation filled the thief's face as she looked around the gigantic vault, her eye spasming as she continued to process just what she was seeing. There were ledges upon ledges lining the room's walls, yet, instead of containing precious stones and gold, silver, and heaps of banknotes like the woman had hoped, the Bat instead found something else entirely.

Rouge found lines of candied, sugary glazed pastries, packed into each bit of available space on every single shelf - not one golden coin or sparkling emerald.

"You. Have. Got to be kidding me..."

The Bat wasn't too jovial about this unusual situation, but that didn't mean she was coming out of this vault empty-handed. Not if her belly had anything to say about it. The pastries' scent filled the room, most of them smelling quite fresh, the emptiness that the woman felt in her stomach growing worse as she stepped further into the strange room.

"Okay, so not a total loss..." The Bat chirred, a little bit of saliva spilling past her luscious pink lips as her belly growled hungrily, "At the very least, I can grab a nibble before finding the real prize here!"

Still salivating, the voluptuous thief stumbled forwards, her hips swaying beneath her black, skintight catsuit as her hunger drug her feet forwards.
115223.title: Rouge's Ponderous Plunder

choices: Rouge ignores her stomach & tries to escape
Rouge falls victim to her own hunger again
Eggman forces Rouge to work with him
An alarm blares; someone's trying to rescue Rouge!
1152231.content:
A sole, harsh whistle blared, a small but jarring trumpet of din from the overhead speakers before the door controls to the vault was sealed away beneath thick, steel plating. A blast door lowered over the already heavily protected doorway to ensure that there was no possible way of cutting through. "Chaos! Stupid!" Rouge growled, grinding her teeth as she recalled Prison Island. She had made a similar error during a break-in there and desired to learn from it, only for her to blunder even worse now, "I should have been more careful..." She sighed, moaned the saliva from her lips with a gloved hand.

"By all means, I'd say you should have!" A voice gloated exultantly from the loudspeakers, none other than Doctor Ivan "Eggman" Robotnik himself, "Prowling around, as usual, I see Rouge!" He laughed, "My, my! How graceless of you, though, confined like the rat with wings you are!"

"Hmph! You just got lucky is all..." Rogue huffed, meandering over to one of the shelving on the wall and picking up a cream horn shakily, turning it over in her hand as her flat stomach began to roar once more, "By the way, nice vault you've got here tubby! Is your hoard locked up somewhere else, or are you so much of a fatass that you genuinely consider this junk food 'treasure'?"

Eggman only laughed once again before answering her, "Oh, you must be calling attention to those blueprints I entitled to fall into your chiropterous little paws! Of course, I wouldn't be so lax in letting something crucial to my enterprise out of my sight! Speaking of 'lax,' it looks like you took the bait to my little trap, lock, stock, and sniper..."

"The dart..." Rouge gasped between gritted teeth as her belly roared again, saliva once more trickling past her lips. "I thought this was too fucking easy..."

Jerking the dart out from its spot within her cleavage, Rouge looked it over once more, scowling as Robotnik continued, "Looks like you get it now, but far too late I'm afraid. You see, my vexing little Bat, the solution now flowing through your veins, is a special blend of my design! A serum for manipulating metabolism, increasing the hunger to the point of crippling desire!"

"No..." Rouge groaned, dropping the dart and grasping at her abdomen as it seized in painful, starving hunger, sweat trickling from her temples as the ampoule exploded against the tile flooring, "You crafty son of a bitch... Then the pastries..."

"Are all yours!" Robotnik cackled madly, reveling in his plan unfolding, all part of it coming into play to trap Rouge just how he had formulated, "You have been a bothersome bone in my throat for far too long, my little bandit! I had a suspicion you'd stick your batty nose into my ventures once I began to assemble resources, so I decided I would identify your strengths and crush them all at once. Your speed, your spryness, your flight! All of them will be null and void when I'm done with you. Or should I say, when you're through with your meal! You see, appetite isn't the only thing my lovely little potion magnifies! It also quickens digestion, and ensures that even more of what you eat is converted into blundering, burdensome fat! I was hoping you would be hit with quite a few of those darts, but I'm sure one will be more than enough to turn you into a complete cow!"

A scream bolted from the batgirl's lips, the thief throwing the cream horn to the ground and shattering it into a profusion of crumbs as she stomped it apart in anger. Yet she doubled over once more, her belly roaring in hunger now as she winced and whined, "No! You can't do this to me you oval-shaped monster; I'll find a way out of this!"

"Oh, sure, you will! Go ahead and try, you irksome rat with wings! I'm sure you'll find it very hard to think of an escape plan as your stupid little animal brain packs to the brim with esurient hunger!" He laughed, "Why not just help yourself in the meantime!? You've come all this way to discover this vault, and here you are! I'm sure you'd rather it go to your waist instead of waste anyways. Hehe..."

"You fat son of a bitch..!"

"Ironic choice of words! Ahahah! Bon' appetite, Rouge!" And with that, the loudspeaker shrilled before cutting out, leaving the imprisoned bandit with only the endless growling of her stomach for company. Rouge reached for the nearest confection, a bear claw, and took a bite. She told herself she would only try a couple of fig rolls at the most, maybe even an eclair, just enough to stop the pain in her belly, to content that tormenting hunger. However, Rouge the Bat had found herself eating dozens of strudels before she could even pause long enough to register what she had done. She gulped and whined as she looked down at the crumbs spilling over her chin and cleavage, and to the bulging pot-belly beyond them.

"I need to stop..." She huffed past a mouthful of baked sweets, even as she continued to shove the rest of the pastries she held into her salivating mouth. But she didn't stop. Instead, she cleaned out an entire shelf's worth of sweet bread. And then moved onto the next, and then the next...

The shelves were emptied one by one, and leisurely but unabatedly, Rouge's belly continued to swell before the Bat's panicked eyes. Before long, the rest of her began to bloat as well, just as Eggman had implied. The batgirl's now round belly churned as it digested the fattening treats fed to it, dutifully turning every bite into thick, soft adipose tissue upon the once thin Bat's frame.

Each bite devoured seemed to be making her meatier, bringing her just a little bit closer towards obesity. Rouge wanted to stop, but she couldn't. The once thin but well-endowed bandit was slowly ballooning, and there was nothing she could do.

Well-muscled legs once used to hauling hoards of treasure softened into thick, blubbery thunder thighs. A belly that could slip past trip wires to allow the Bat to claim her well-guarded prizes distended with food, and then sagged with fat as it bulged against her skintight jumpsuit, folding over into dense, thick rolls of fat that caused the material to creak unnervingly. Rouge's rear end did little to help her beleaguered outfit. The incredibly tight, though gratefully pliable catsuit left little to the imagination as her posterior swelled, her blubbery cheeks bulging and drawing the rubbery material deep between her crack.

Rouge's pink chest-plate began to creak too, her bosom, already quite sizeable, left uncovered to catch both adversary and ally alike off their guard, cascading forwards as her tits swelled to even more obscene sizes. Even Rouge's face wasn't spared from her rapidly expanding weight, her cheeks cushioning as the once sharp features of her skull was lost in plush flab.

Hours passed. Thousands of sweets were devoured. Hundreds of pounds were gained, turning the lithe bandit into a heavy-footed colossus.

And still, her belly continued to growl.




"Ohohoho!" Eggman cackled ardently to himself, hands clutched behind his back as the red-suited scientist strutted proudly down the hallway. His stomach preceded him as he walked, the villain between two specialized, especially brawny E-Series sentinels equipped with machine guns. The demented genius came to a stop as he entered the vault, stopping to gaze at his handiwork.

Rouge the Bat lay there, leaning back indolently on the floor, one plump hand holding up her head as the other plucked apple strudels one by one from a small, dwindling pile next to her and plopped them past her drool-drenched lips. The batgirl, now doubtlessly fat, looked up at Eggman with half-lidded eyes. She chewed and swallowed the latest morsel of thousands that had filled her stomach, before letting loose a tremendous burp, sending drool gliding from her lips.

"Well, well, well!" Eggman cackled to himself, grinning from ear to ear, "If it isn't Rouge the Fat! It would certainly appear that my concoction is more than effective, but how does my newest test subject feel?"

The rotund bandit grunted as she licked her lips free of crumbs, only to dirty them again as she shoved another strudel into her maw, "Starving," She muttered past a mouthful of food, "Seems as it's going to take more than a room filled with food to finish me off, fatass."

Eggman laughed in mirth as he looked the flabby Bat over, "First of all, let's not call the kettle black, now shall we?" He mused, materializing a portable clicker from behind his back, "Second, you are my prisoner now, but I am not without cordiality."

Thumbing one of the toggles on the clicker, some steel panels around the room retracted from the floor, concealing furniture that now rose from compartments beneath the vault. A bed with a narrow mattress and no blankets, a washbasin, and a looking-glass rose into view. Each piece of furniture was simplistic and austere, yet all of them were enormous, plainly made for somebody even bigger than Rouge was at this point. The embellishments of a jail cell meant to serve the needs of the world's fattest prisoner.

"You may find them a little awkward at first, but I assure you, my dear, you will grow to appreciate them! In more ways than one..." He chuckled with delight, "As for food, I will make sure that my robot servants restock the entire room! Constantly. Rather kind of me to host my plump guest in a room, don't you agree, especially after all the trouble you and your friends have put me through over the years! I assure you, my tubby thief, despite what you may be experiencing, you will never go hungry ever again..."
1152231.title: Eggman's Trap

choices: Something rolls into the vault - a bomb!
Meanwhile, somewhere else on the ship...
Rouge decides to stick around for the food
Shadow the hedgehog comes in as well
11522314.content:
"So, that's the plan, then, Eggman?" Rouge grumbled as she nibbled her caloric meal, "I'll give you this; that's a creative one for you."

"Ohoho, yes, well, that IS the plan. However, I'm going to require a helping hand, or paw, in carrying out the rest of my plot..."

The fat bat scowled at him, smacking her lips as she ate, "Yeah, well fat chance."

"Fortunately for me..." Robotnik continued, pulling a polaroid camera from one of his coat's pockets, "It does not require us working together."

"Photoshoot, huh? Cute." Rouge chirred erotically, sticking her fat breasts out. Each tit threatened to spill out of her tight catsuit as she shoveled the remaining five strudels off the ground, placing each one onto her thick, sausage-like fingers and grinning alluringly at the crazed scientist. "Tell me, Eggy, how do I look?" Eggman snapped the photo, filling the already brightly-lit vault with a flash as the picture printed out onto a compact card.

Grabbing it, Eggman shook the image, laughing as he looked it over, "Marvelous! I'm sure it will be an outstanding enticement for your mettlesome little playmates. Especially that ballsy red echidna chum you like to hang around with!"

A warm reddening unrolled across Rouge's fat cheeks as she thought of Knuckles seeing her body like this, but she tightened her eyes. A serene smile split her chubby face as she glowered at her captor, "And I'm sure it will make a splendid memento for when I escape and teal everything you own, you bag of shit!" She smugly smiled, plopping the rest of the strudels into her mouth gladly as her plump belly growled loudly, "It will give me something to remember your crazy plan by once I escape and lose all of this weight!"

The doctor's smile dropped somewhat, but he let out an amused chuckle, "I know you will do your best to get out of here. However, I'm afraid you'll find with all that lard weighing you down now, your best isn't what it used to be!" He smirked, handing the camera and photograph off to his mechanical sentinels before stepping backward along with them over the threshold of the vault door as it and the blast doors began to seal shut slowly. "However, if you want to get out of here, I propose you do it posthaste... Your next meal arrives in an hour. You may not be too fat to annoy me just yet, but just wait until you've had your second course!"

Chuckling, Eggman walked off as the doors fastened shut behind him, leaving Rouge alone with the roaring of her belly and a room now utterly devoid of food. Shifting her now over 300-pound body off the ground, Rouge tried not to think about the pain, slowly filling her far more giant belly once again, looking around the room for something that would be of use to get her out of here.



Doctor Ivan Robotnik had done it; he had successfully captured Rouge the Bat. Well, for now, anyway. Catching the blue rodent and his friends wasn't ever too tricky; it was getting them to stay put that was a challenge. The blue needle-mouse alone had more energy inside him than your average nuclear reactor, and the rodents together were off the charts, so keeping some of that hyperactivity inside a cage proved frustrating. Even with his plan of weighing that energy down with dense fat, there was an annoying whisper at the back of his head telling him it might not be enough.

Eggman had been watching the bat try to squirm her way out of the vault for ten minutes. This was perfect; the weight gain may not be enough to turn the bat into a helpless blob, but he had a back-up plan. Until the next shipment of fattening snacks enter her cell in under an hour, he could finally test out something new he had just been dying to show the rat with wings. They were reliable, Sonic, and his entourage, but they weren't quite so powerful without the blue blur to back them up, were they? He looked again at the monitor showing Rouge's cell.

The bat seemed to have given up on trying to escape, at least for now. Still, her eyes were darting around the room, probably looking for something that could help her leave. But Rouge would find not a single thing out of place. Eggman had been preparing this for months, and he wasn't going to ruin his plan by being careless. "Sir?" A slightly robotic voice drew him out of his inner monologue, and he looked to his side to see Orbot floating attentively. "Everything is for your presentation."

Eggman gave a sinister smile to the monitor before cracking his knuckles. "Perfect. Begin the simulation."



Rouge was having a bad day, and that was an understatement. It was bad enough that Eggface had kidnapped her. It was humbling at the very least for her to put on hundreds of pounds of adipose tissue thanks to the doctor's dart. But all that she could think about, aside from escape, is Robotnik waving around that photo to Knuckles, Shadow, or anyone else she cared about. The added heft to her frame wasn't so hard to get used to, and she appreciated that most of that fat congregated to her curves.

But the thought of her friends seeing her like this was just something that made her skin crawl. She had spent years cultivating her persona as a seductive, sultry, treasure thief; she didn't need people thinking about her like she was some prized hog at the state fair. The cherry on top of her predicament? The most realistic scenario she can think of in which she escapes from Eggman's clutches...is if her friends save her. Playing the role as the damsel in distress was never high on her checklist, and right now, it was at rock bottom.

Now she was stuck in a stupid dreary cell with an empty stomach. She had nothing better to do for the next hour when the next shipment of food comes. She could wait, right? Of course, she could, she's Rouge the Bat, dammit! This would be easy, just sit still and wait for rescue/food; she can do this!

She can do this.

...

...

...

It took about five seconds for the bandit to get bored out of her mind when she wasn't eating or thinking about escaping. She tapped her heart-adorned boots on the vault's floor, sounding much more audible thanks to the extra weight she put on. How long had she been here? Her guess would be somewhere between an hour and eternity. What was taking that damn doctor so long?!

"Hey, Eggman! Quit playing with your mustache and hurry it up! Your favorite prisoner is hungry!" She shouted, only half expecting a response. A few seconds passed, and nothing. She continued to tap her foot, as though the heavy tapping noise would somehow move the time. She spotted the camera near the northwest corner of the vault's ceiling and glared at it. "Come on! It's got to have been an hour by now! Is this really how you treat your guests?!" She whined; if she were going to put up with this, she would make sure that Eggman had to listen to her complain.

However, this finally seemed to catch his attention as there was a crackling noise of an intercom turning on. "It's been twelve minutes, Rodent!" Spat the doctor. Rouge just smirked, having irritated him.

"Well, sorry, Eggface, but every second in here feels like an hour!" She grinned. The bat could hear more annoyed grumbling from the intercom, probably giving an order to one of his robots. "Hey, since I have your attention, I never get why you always call me a rodent. I guess it's because you think of all of us as 'pests', but-"

"My definition of rodent is someone who always annoys me and should end up as roadkill on the side of a highway," the human interjected.

Rouge subtly finches at the visual "...ouch." But soon, a grin took over her chubby face. "Going by that, I am free to call you a rodent as well." Eggman honestly wasn't surprised the thief responded the way she did.

"No! No, because I'm not a dirty aminal-"

"But you are a stinky human, and that counts, right?" Rouge jeeringly waved a hand under her nose.

The man saw red. "I do not stink! But since you're so determined to be a thorn in my side, I have good news; your waiting is done!" Eggman started doing a cartoonishly evil laugh, that made Rouge want to roll his eyes more than anything, "I've just got to–"

Suddenly, to Rouge's surprise, the whole airship lurched to the side, making her lose her footing. Ungracefully, she fell to the cold metal floor, her plumpened posterior cushioning her fall, before sliding to one of her cell's walls. "Damn it! Not now! I haven't even used the bait, yet! How did-" The intercom cut off before Rouge could hear more, but her ears perked up. Was that them already? Her question was quickly answered when the blast door to the vault started denting and shaking, and finally flying off to reveal Amy with her Piko Piko hammer.

"Ah, Pink!" Rouge grinned before a soft blush spread to her cheeks. "Not the way I'd like you to see me, but better you then Shads or Knuckles."

"Oh please," the pink hedgie rolled her eyes, "Those two idiots will fall for you no matter how you look." She complained, smashing a robot that had followed her in. Before she could counter or reply, Tails flew in, his face immediately lighting up upon seeing the now 300 lb bat.

1155521.content:
Blaze watched as the smoking wreck of the Egg-O-Matic shot across the sky. It's controller, one Dr. Eggman, could be seen pressing every button he could in some attempt to turn the device back on. But it was simply no use as he and his contraption vanished beyond the horizon, leaving the small group of Sonic and his pals alone in the broken lab.

Blaze brushed her coat, removing a few metal shavings from the cloth. "Good riddance. Again. Honestly Sonic, does Eggman attack you so often?"

The princess turned to the blue hedgehog, who was streching as if he had gone through a mere workout rather than saving the day. "Yeah, you get used to it. That Egghead just doesn't know when to give up."

Blaze stepped through the debris of the Dr's latest failure, though what that failure was could be debated. Tails, was standing over by a stack of large, open containers holding some kind of green gel. His tails twirled in curiosity as he held a scanner to a leaking barrel. "I'm not sure he even knew what he was doing." The young fox said. "Whatever this compound is, it doesn't seem to have any energized properties."

Blaze had to admit, she was having trouble seeing what the doctor's plans were herself. She wasn't as scientifically inclined as Sonic's friend, but there were hardly any robots guarding the lab. In thought, Blaze turned back to Sonic. The self-proclaimed Blue Blur was talking to Amy, Rouge and Kunckles, patting them all on the back for a job well done. It was almost amusing, for all of his faults, Sonic truly was a hero. Selfless and certainly there for those he cared about. And look where that got him, loads of friends or at least rivals who respected him. All those years Blaze had spent alone and where did that get her?

Blaze's ears flicked as a groaning scratch sounded. Blaze turned back to the poorly balanced barrels Tails was examining, the pile was starting to rip. Being closer to Tails, Blaze rushed towards the fox. Her desire to protect her friend sparked her powers as a flame formed around her. She pushed Tails to the side as the barrels began to topple. Her fear of her own damage increased the heat of her flames.

As the gel touched her flame, the red surrounding Blaze turned purple. Before Tails could pull himself up and say anything, she was gone.

It was as if she was weightless. Blaze found herself floating through a swirling vortex of pink and purple, falling and yet feeling like she was going nowhere. The time passed, Blaze could make out something coming at her. As the figure came closer, Blaze couldn't believe her eyes. It was difficult to see much of the details, but she was too certain that what she was seeing before her was herself. The being in front of her looked so much like her, her face, colors and everything. But this Blaze was wearing a far more regal outfit, purple lipstick adorning her lips and was glaring at her with a cold look. Not the kind of cold that comes from pushing away people, but the kind of cold that came from a dark heart. The two Blaze's floated beside one another for a minute, neither knowing what to say to the other before both were pulled past each other. Blaze watched as the figure vanished, wondering just what she had gotten herself into.

1155542.content:
(Ah, you can’t beat the classics…~)

======

At first glance, Amy Rose was simply an ordinary pink hedgehog, but she also happened to be the biggest fan of the mightiest hero on the planet of Mobius, Sonic the hedgehog. Of course, she was not literally his biggest fan, but as the oxymoron suggests she was the most obsessed one. Amy had constant daydreams and the kind you get sleeping at night.

About her and her beloved hero getting married. However, the pink fanatic had one problem that was delaying that dream goal of hers…

Almost every day, Amy would find herself in the same tiring routine, where the young girl would chase after her hero everywhere; and Sonic would either flee or make up some excuse to leave. Nothing was changing. History was sort of a song on repeat. But despite these setbacks, Amy refused to give up as the pink wonder was determined to make her hero entirely hers!

And today, she may have found that solution…

While out doing some shopping for her place, Amy unexpectedly came across her hero outside of the store, where he was reading a magazine in his hands. The pink hedgehog almost unleashed a cheerful squeal before covering her mouth; not wanting to blow this opportunity. However, just before she could make her move, Sonic in a second boosted off! Creating an enormous gust of wind that almost blew Amy away.

Once the wind cleared, Amy unfettered a defeated sigh before suddenly getting her face smacked by the magazine Sonic was reading earlier. Peeling the book of her face, Amy, out of curiosity wondered what Sonic was even reading or looking at.

Flipping through the pages, it looked like any other leisure magazine, until Amy came across an interesting double-page, where the young girl’s eyes were soon met with something she had never considered. Just the mere sight of it almost made her eyes jump out from their sockets from what she saw.

“Sonic... likes them big?” Amy murmured in surprise, the two pages in front of her showing exceedingly large women all dressed in skimpy clothes and alluring lingerie.

Pinching her flat stomach, Amy’s dumbfounded expression into a confident smirk. “Well then, if he wants the fattest around...” Closing the magazine in her hands and stuffing it into her shopping bag. “Then I got some work to do...”

Let it never be said that Vanilla wasn't a good mother, and if anyone did dare to say it she wouldn't listen.

Vanilla was busy dusting the house, humming to herself as she did so. Cream was off visiting Tails so she had the whole day to herself.

Oh how she cared for her precious little Cream. She loved her daughter more than anything else. And like any good mother, she only wanted what was best for her little girl. Ever since her husband died, it was up to her to raise her kid right. And for so long, she did. But ever since that harrowing adventure where she had been kidnapped by Dr. Eggman, Vanilla had begun to notice something about Cream. A more adventurous side of her was coming out, a side that was unafraid of danger...or more specifically how much danger she was in.

Vanilla sighed as she sat down on the couch, a picture of Cream on the end table beside her. "Oh Cream, I want you to be happy, I truly do. But I worry so much and I'm only one mother. If only a few of Sonic's friends were more like me. More calm and happy with simply taking care of a house. If only to give you more influence than just being a reckless hooligan."

With that thought, Vanilla sat up. "Maybe...oh but Cream would surely find out...or if not her than someone else. Sonic certainly wouldn't be happy." The worries ran about in Vanilla's head until she looked back to the picture of Cream. "I have to. For her sake."

It was then Vanilla knew what she had to do. She was going to teach some of her friends the joys of being a simple housewife, even if they didn't want it. After all, it was for Cream above all else.

Vanilla rushed upstairs to her room, grabbing the Chaos Emerald Sonic had given her. "This should help me."

Infinite fell to you, and while you needed the help of two Sonics to do it, you beat one of Eggman's most dangerous robots, earning the respect of the entire Resistance.

Now, you worked alongside the Restoration to clear out the last remaining bits of Eggman's Empire, fighting against Egg Bosses and robots to reclaim Eggman's territory.

Wilde didn't know what was wrong with him. Ever since the defeat of Infinite and Eggman a month ago, he had been feeling more and more sick. He eventually identified the feeling as hunger, but nothing seemed to help. The Mobian wolf groaned, collapsing and clutching his stomach. "GAAAH! So HUNGRY..." he moaned. He had been getting steadily worse as time went on. No matter what he ate, he just got hungrier and hungrier. He had developed a small pot belly from his overeating, which had gotten worse as time went on. He needed SOMETHING to eat. Something which would satisfy the growing need in his stomach. But nothing, not even chilidogs, his favorite, seemed to satisfy him at all.

"I'm gonna go nuts," Wilde moaned, clutching his midsection as he tried to pull himself upright. "I need to eat, but I don't know what to eat, and..."

"Hey... Wilde, right?" said a voice. Wilde looked up, and realized he recognized the person talking to him. And, to his growing distress, they looked delicious. He couldn't help but stare at them with a hungry need, drooling a little...

"Um... you okay there, pal? You're kind of creeping me out," said the person.

125512.content:
Sonic groaned, waking up. "Damn... What hit me?" he said, rubbing his head as he got to his fight. As his vision cleared, he noticed his fellow Freedom Fighters all around him. Sally, Antoine, Bunnie, Nicole, Rotor, Tails, and Amy were all picking themselves up. Nicole chuckled weakly. "I picked a terrible time to test my prototype new body," she said, the lynx hugging Sally. To Sonic's surprise, Shadow and Rouge were there as well, along with Vector and Espio of the Chaotix, Knuckles, Tangle, and Whisper. Antoine's sword was missing, as was Amy's hammer. Whisper had been stripped of her Wispon multi-tool and mask, and was looking around frantically for them, Tangle doing her best to comfort her friend.

"Everyone okay?" he asked.

"No, Sonic," Shadow said irritably. "We've all been kidnapped, probably by Dr. Eggman."

"What's the last thing everyone remembers?" Sally asked.

"A bright red flash..." Knuckles said, frowning. "You don't suppose it could be Infinite again?"

"You're half-right," said a voice, Sonic groaning in frustration.

"Oh no..." Sonic said.

"Nice to see you too," Breezie said, her silhouetted form coming on the only viewscreen in the room. Everyone in the room glared up at their captor, the green hedgehog also the ruler of Casinopolis and the greatest media power in all of Mobius.

"What do you want, Breezie?" Sally demanded.

"I want you to participate in my new show," Breezie said, only her eyes visible in the shadows that filled her office. "But considering WHAT my new show is, I figured you'd need... persuasion. So I tracked down Infinite and extracted the power of the Phantom Ruby from him. Its all at MY command now."

"Well, that's not good," Bunnie understanded.

"No kidding," Tails said.

"If you're worried about your stuff, don't worry," Breezie said. "You'll get it back for the show. I just wanted to make sure you were all aware of WHO IS IN CHARGE."

"For now," Shadow growled. Breezie just chuckled.

"So, what, are we competing against each other?" Amy asked.

"Sometimes," Breezie said. "Mostly, you'll be competing against your co-stars." She gestured to a wall, which retracted to reveal a glass panel. Everyone's heart sank as they saw who was on the other side of it.

Eggman's Egg Bosses. The elegant Clove and her sister Cassia. The vicious Akhlut. The graceful Nephthys. The cunning Lord Hood. The pirate queen Abyss. The brutal Tundra. The deadly Conquering Storm. Ruler of the roads Axel. The mad Eggman-loyalist Thunderbolt. The mysterious Maw. The mighty kukku Battlelord. And the troll witch Wendy Naugus. In addition, Eggman's newly recruited assistant, Dr. Starline, and the technomage Regina Ferrum and sometimes Eggman ally were there as well. They were glaring at the Freedom Fighters in a mix of curiosity and fury.

"You should have seen Eggman's face when I defeated and captured all of his minions at once," Breezie said, grinning at the memory.

"Well, this is gonna be fun," Knuckles said, smirking. "Always wanted to bust up all of these guys at once."

"Oh, it's not gonna be like that," Breezie said. "You see, the show's format is..."
125512.title: Breezie's New Show

14111.content:
The long-legged pronghorn deer Mobian walked carefully into the abandoned facility. The green furred young woman tightly clutched her staff, the metal toes of her hoof-like boots clicking lightly on the ground. Her name was Clove, and she was a cyborg, an Egg Boss of the Eggman Empire. She only reluctantly served her lord, as her sister Cassia had a health condition that only Eggman could keep at bay. But as Eggman was a scientist rather than a physician, he could ONLY keep it at bay and not cure it. She kept this fact from Cassia, not wanting to steal her sister's hope. She, like all Egg Bosses, wore a variant of Eggman's clothing, her pants black and her coat gray with white highlights and gold, square-shaped buttons. Her boots had gold trim, lining the shape of her hooved feet.

She walked through the abandoned mine shaft, ready to trigger her staff's energy scythe at a moment's notice. Around her, four Motobug badniks and two Egg Pawns, their glowing eyes acting as flashlights, acted as her bodyguards, the Egg Pawns carrying energy rifles. Things had been going wrong at the mine shaft, hindering the investigation into a possible well of magical Golden Rings. Equipment failures, up to and including explosions, were happening at random with no known cause. Knowing that Eggman would get grumpy and possibly punish her if a potential source of power was lost, she decided to lead an investigation into the mine, having the Motobugs record everything and broadcast it back to the base.

Her younger sister, Cassia, didn't want her to go alone. But Clove had refused to risk any of her troops, and had gone in with only Badniks for backup. She would do whatever it took to protect her sister.

"Scan for any anomolies. Report immediately if mechanical failure starts to occur," Clove ordered. The robots all confirmed the order as they moved deeper and deeper into the facility. Clove didn't like how quiet things were. It made her nervous.

Eventually, they came to a blockade, stones collapsed along the path. She frowned, and ordered the Egg Pawns to stand back. She began to examine the fallen rocks, trusting in her cybernetically enhanced speed and agility to get her out of danger should something go wrong. As she examined the rocks, she noticed something. A strange light pulsing at the back of a tiny hole. She peered in close, trying to get a better look at it. "It looks almost like Dark Ga-" she stopped when she recognized what she was about to say. She realized her mistake moments too late, and was about to call in one of the Egg Pawns to look at it in her place, when a burst of purple smoke shot out. Before she could stop herself, she inhaled it, coughing and wheezing. She clutched at her throat, desperately gasping for breath, coughing up blood as her vision went black...

When she woke up, her uniform was in tatters. The robots and the Mobini powering them were all ripped to shreds, and Clove could taste blood in her mouth. Frightened, she found her staff and used the energy scythe's light to guide her out of the cave as fast as possible. She had to get back to base. She needed to figure out what happened, why her clothes and her robotic minions were destroyed.

She told herself over and over again that the Mobini didn't have bite marks in them. That the blood in her mouth was her own.

She almost believed it.
14111.title: Clove the Werebeast

Dr. Starline! Eggman fan and vaguely avian mad scientist! What will he get into?

1.) Dr. Starline is kidnapped by the Freedom Fighters! All according to plan...

154.title: Doctor Starline

choices: Dr. Starline tries out the Fattener on Lien-Da
Dr. Starline tries out the Bimboizer on Lien-Da
Dr. Starline uses the Transformicron on Lien-Da
Lien-Da realizes what Dr. Starline is planning and starts a fight...
The two look at more weapons
1542.content:
"My lord?" Dr. Starline asked, the avian mad scientist staring curiously at the vault before him. "What's in here?"

Dr. Eggman grimaced. "Oh! Oh. That thing," he said. Nearby, the cybernetic echidna warlord, Lien-Da snickered. Eggman sighed. "That is a repository of all my... sillier ideas. I kept them to remind myself not to make them again."

"...Sillier than Scratch, Grounder, and Coconuts?" Dr. Starline asked, clearly baffled by the concept.

"Still can't believe Breezie was able to find use for those losers..." Eggman muttered. "Anyway. They're reasonably effective weapons, but what they do is just so ridiculous... I couldn't bring myself to actually use them..."

"...Conisdering your aversion to simple pragmatism, I'm surprised you didn't," Dr. Starline said, Lien-Da taking a very large step away from him.

Eggman snorted. "You're lucky you're damn useful..." he muttered. "The reason I didn't use them is that doing so would humiliate me as much as it would Sonic and his friends. If you want to play with the stupid things, be my guest. Passcode is H4t3th4th3dg3h0g. I'm going to see if I can give Orbot and Cubot combat capability. Getting tired of them not doing much around here..."

With that, Eggman stomped off, the Silly Vault opening up. Lien-Da walked up to Starline, impressed. "He didn't vaporize you for backsassing him. That's new..."

"Unlike you and your mercenary 'Dark Legion,'" Dr. Starline said, ignoring the glare Lien-Da gave him, "I prove my worth to our dear delightful lunatic every day." He entered the passcode, the vault door opening and revealing several blasters that, indeed, looked quite silly. Lien-Da, curious, looked in the vault as well... and stared right alongside Dr. Starline, struggling to process what she was seeing.

"...Are we looking at Dr. Eggman's fetishes right now?" Lien-Da asked.

"No, the Doctor is completely asexual," Dr. Starline said. When Lien-Da gave him an inquiring look, he said, "One of his lower minions attempted to sexually accoust Vanilla the Rabbit when we held her prisoner one time. Eggman yelled at him, claiming that 'sex is disgusting, and if you want to act like an animal, don't do it in my base.'"

"And then he killed him," Lien-Da surmised.

"And then he killed him," Dr. Starline confirmed, nodding.

"Well, at least I never have to worry about getting raped by the big fat bastard..." Lien-Da muttered as she and Dr. Starline walked into the vault, looking over the various weapons.

"Rape, I think, is the least of your worries when dealing with Dr. Eggman..." Dr. Starline muttered. "...Oh dear. I can see why this one would be bothersome to the Doctor's dignity." He paused in front of a device filled with a yellow liquid. It resembled a dart gun with rapid fire syringe projectiles that were filled with the foul-looking yellow liquid.

Lien-Da leaned in, reading the label underneath the gun. "The Fattener. Any Mobian struck with these dart projectiles will become impossibly, incredibly fat and gain a tremendous appetite, wanting to do little more than eat and sleep and attempt to fuck. The effects of the formula also spread, turning other Mobians into gluttons, their bodies processing everything they eat into fat, leaving no bodily waste," she read.

Dr. Starline frowned. "Actually, that sounds rather effective," he said. "Why not use it?"

"What would you do with the affected afterwards?" Lien-Da asked.

Dr. Starline thought a moment, and shrugged. "Hmm, point taken..." he said. Although he began to think of ways to impliment it effectively...

The two moved on, coming across a gun covered in glitter, looking like a disco ball with a gun stock attached to it. "...The Bimboizer," Dr. Starline read.

"Oh hell the fuck no," Lien-Da said, scowling.

Dr. Starline smirked, reading the text underneath the weapon. "Affects both male and female Mobians, turning males into females before the primary effects occur. Any female affected by this gun's rays will become large breasted and curvaceous bodies, as well as decreased intelligence and a greatly increased sex drive." He turned towards Lien-Da, eyebrow quirking.

Lien-Da glared back. "Say it and you die," she said.

Dr. Starline snickered and moved on. The two of them walked through the lab, looking through the various odd experiments, until another caught Dr. Starline and Lien-Da's attention. "The Transformicron - A device that can transform any living Mobian back and forth from an inanimate object," Lien-Da read. "Wait, this could actually be a powerful weapon!"

"Read on," Dr. Starline said. "'Discarded because the only thing it turned people into was female-shaped sex toys.'"

Lien-Da huffed. "Well, that sucks," she said, walking off. Dr. Starline just looked over the device thoughtfully, ideas formulating in his head...
1542.title: The Vault of Eggman's Mistakes

choices: Starline scores a hit on Lien-Da, turning her into a sexy, stupid bimbo...
Lien-Da gets the Bimboizer away from Starline and uses it on him...
Eggman comes in and accidentally gets hit...
Lien-Da fights back with a different weapon...
15422.content:
"Hmmm..." Dr. Starline said, walking back to and looking over the Bimboizer. He gently picked up the device, getting a feel for the oddly-shapd weapon. He found where the barrel was through careful examination, the barrel popping out and the gun activating, making a glittery noise. "Very intersting..."

Lien-Da paused. There was an unravelling sound, Dr. Starline glancing over and seeing that Lien-Da had unfurled her whip. "...You'd better not be doing what is it I think you're doing," she said in a low, dangerous tone.

Dr. Starline grinned wickedly. "And what is it you think I'm doing?" he said.

"I think you're playing with one of the doctor's dangerous toys," Lien-Da said. Her muscles were tensing, the red-furred echidna ready to move. "I think you're about to make a mistake you're going to regret for a long time."

Dr. Starline's grin widened. "No... No, I don't think that's what's happening. All I'm doing is conducting a little scientific experiment," he said, taking aim.

"I DON'T THINK SO!" Lien-Da said, lashing out with her electrified whip. Dr. Starline, anticipating this, teleported out of the way, dropping through a portal and reappearing in front of her. But Lien-Da moved surprisingly fast, lashing out with a kick that forced Dr. Starline to teleport again. Dr. Starline reappeared far away, firing, but Lien-Da dodged out of the way, lashing her whip towards him again, sending a blade of electricity towards him. He portaled out of the way again.

"You won't get in the way of SCIENCE!" Dr. Starline said, laughing wickedly. His hand was aching from using the Warp Topaz over and over so quickly, but he wasn't about to lose this fight. Especially since Lien-Da was likely to use the weapon against him should he fail.
15422.title: Fight It Out!

155412.content:
Bubsy was a bobcat. And he wasn't having a good time of things. His fame was minimal, overshadowed by dozens of other video game franchises. The orange-furred bobcat sneered as he surfed the web, gauging the importance of a series by how much porn it had. And so far, in his poor judgement, he had decided that the Sonic franchise was the most popular in the world.

"I don't get it," he muttered. "People complain about their games, especially the myuwer ones, all the time! And yet they're just so damn popular!" He huffed, glaring at Sonic. "I'm cool! I have cattitude! Heck, I sling puns all the time! I got two puns in that rant I said just nyow!" He shook his head. "I friggin' hate that hedgehog. How could he pawsibly be more stylish than me? Hedgehogs don't run fast! They're adorable little spike balls!" He failed to recognize that his ability to float through the air was an ability regular bobcats didn't have.

He paced around. He'd finally gotten a revival, but his games didn't do that good. (They did worlds better than his first games, mind you, but it wasn't enough for the fame-starved bobcat.) "...It's gotta be Sonic's fault," Bubsy misjudged. "He's stealing my fanbase!" He made his decision. "I'm gonna make them pay! I'm gonna..."
